servinfo.title: Front Wheel Alignment Inspection and Adjustment

servinfosub.title: Toe Inspection and Adjustment
servinfosub.ptxt: Preparation for toe inspection and adjustment.

item.ptxt: Place vehicle in unloaded state on level surface.
Set steering wheel in straight state.
Check that inflation pressure of each tire is adjusted properly and wheel is free from deflection.
Check that each suspension part is free from bend, dent, wear or damage in any other form.
Check that ground clearance at the right and left is just about the same.

topic.title: Inspection
topic.ptxt: Toe should be within following specifications.
If toe is out of the specification, adjust toe properly.

s1.ptxt: Loosen right and left tie-rod end lock nuts (1) first.
Rotate right and left tie-rods (2) by the same amount to align toe to specification. In this adjustment, the lengths “A” of both right and left tie-rod should be equal.

attention3.ptxt: Before rotating tie-rods (2), apply grease between tie-rods and rack boots so that boots won’t be twisted.

s1.ptxt: After adjustment, tighten lock nuts (1) to specified torque.

attention3.ptxt: Make sure that rack boots are not twisted.

servinfosub.title: Steering Angle Check and Adjustment
servinfosub.ptxt: When tie-rod or tie-rod end was replaced, check toe and then also steering angle with turning radius gauge (1).
If steering angle is not correct, check whether right and left tie-rods length “A” are equal.

attention3.ptxt: If tie-rod lengths were changed to adjust steering angle, reinspect toe-in.

topic.title: Side slip
topic.ptxt: When checked with side slip tester, side slip should satisfy following specification.

spec.title: Side slip
spec.ptxt: IN 1.5 to OUT 1.5 mm/m (IN 0.0591 to OUT 0.0591 in. / 3.3 ft)

topic.ptxt: If side slip is greatly different, toe or front wheel alignment may not be correct.
